item.title: Wanted
item.description: Wanted is an Italian western film released in 1967. It was directed by Giorgio Ferroni and starring Giuliano Gemma, Teresa Gimpera, and Nello Pazzafini. Gemma made two more westerns directed by Ferroni, with similar plots, where his character likewise carried the first name "Gary".

item.title: For a Few Dollars Less
item.description: For a Few Dollars Less is a 1966 Italian comedy film parody of For a Few Dollars More directed by Mario Mattoli and starring Lando Buzzanca. It was Mattoli's final film.

item.title: The Three Musketeers of the West
item.description: Tutti per uno... botte per tutti, internationally released as The Three Musketeers of the West, is a 1973 Italian spaghetti western-comedy film directed by Bruno Corbucci.

item.title: Arizona Colt
item.description: Arizona Colt, also known as The Man from Nowhere, is a Spaghetti Western directed by Michele Lupo and starring Giuliano Gemma, Fernando Sancho and Corinne Marchand.

item.title: Minnesota Clay
item.description: Minnesota Clay is a 1964 Italian/French/Spanish international co-production spaghetti western directed by Sergio Corbucci.

item.title: Run, Man, Run!
item.description: Run, Man, Run is an Italian-French Zapata Western film. It is the second film of Sergio Sollima centred on the character of Cuchillo, again played by Tomas Milian, after the two-years earlier successful western The Big Gundown. It is also the final chapter of the political-western trilogy of Sollima, and his last spaghetti western. According to the same Sollima, Run, Man, Run is the most politic, the most revolutionary and even anarchic among his movies.
